bug.summary: TypeError: unsupported format string passed to Tensor.__format__ during printing at validation stage
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I get error "TypeError: unsupported format string passed to Tensor.format". I suspect the code here need to be changed.
pytorch-lightning/pytorch_lightning/callbacks/model_checkpoint.py
Line 585 in 51cc7a8
f"Epoch {epoch:d}, global step {step:d}: {self.monitor} reached {current:0.5f}"
<denchmark-h:h2>Please reproduce using [the BoringModel and post here]</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>>>> import torch >>> x = torch.Tensor([0]) >>> x tensor([0.]) >>> type(x) <class 'torch.Tensor'> >>> y = torch.Tensor([1]) >>> f" {x:0.5f} (best {y:0.5f})," Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/home/sonwang/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 419, in __format__ return object.__format__(self, format_spec) TypeError: unsupported format string passed to Tensor.__format__ >>> f" {x.item():0.5f} (best {y.item():0.5f})," ' 0.00000 (best 1.00000),' </denchmark-code>
current, best_model_score in the code cited are both tensors, it will throw the same errors When I used the original code. Suggestd changes: rank_zero_info( f"Epoch {epoch:d}, global step {step:d}: {self.monitor} reached {current.item():0.5f}" f' (best {self.best_model_score.item():0.5f}), saving model to "{filepath}" as top {k}' )

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SeanNaren>@SeanNaren</denchmark-link> Thanks for pointing me to the script. I was not able to reproduce the errors. I found there is no bug here. "current" is a torch.Tensor and scaler (shape == torch.Size([]) It is my mistake by confusing torch.Tensor() and torch.tensor(). <denchmark-code>>>>import torch >>> x = torch.Tensor(1) >>> print(f"{x:0.5f}") Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/home/sonwang/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 419, in __format__ return object.__format__(self, format_spec) TypeError: unsupported format string passed to Tensor.__format__ >>> x.shape torch.Size([1]) >>> print(f"{x.item():0.5f}") 0.00000 >>> x tensor([1.3272e-09])
